properties.Title: Player Spawn Dig Prevention
properties.UserDescription: Prevents digging or mining below the player spawn to keep admin presets safe

Location.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="DigOrMine">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="DigOrMine">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position where the interaction took place.

Citizen.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the interaction.

properties.Title: Capital Claim Protection
properties.UserDescription: Only Game Masters are permitted to claim or unclaim property inside the Federal Capital

Location.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="ClaimOrUnclaimProperty">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="ClaimOrUnclaimProperty">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position of the claim.

Citizen.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who claimed or unclaimed the land.

List.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PlaceOrPickUpObject">Placing Object</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PlaceOrPickUpObject">Placing Object</ecoicon>: Was the item placed?

When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PlaceOrPickUpObject">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PlaceOrPickUpObject">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position where the interaction took place.

properties.UserDescription: Citizens may freely chop stumps and cleanup tree debris inside unica

properties.UserDescription: Vehicles may be placed anywhere on the capital roads

properties.Title: Capital Property Buying Regulations
properties.UserDescription: Every Citizen may only have one property in the Federal Capital

Citizen.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PropertyTransfer">New Owner</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PropertyTransfer">New Owner</ecoicon>: New owner of the property being transfered.

Location.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PropertyTransfer">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PropertyTransfer">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position of the property.

Citizen.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PropertyTransfer">New Owner</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PropertyTransfer">New Owner</ecoicon>: New owner of the property being transfered.

properties.Title: Capital Renting Access Regulations
properties.UserDescription: Inside the Capital, Residents are not permitted to access inventories or to transfer items between inventories that they were able to open (e.g. a vehicle). Therefore, landowners in the Capital can rent out their property to people for a SP gain without fearing that they misuse their workshop or containers (which is normally possible for residents).

Location.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="OpenAction">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="OpenAction">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position where the interaction took place.

Citizen.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

properties.Title: Declaration of Protest
properties.UserDescription: If a citizen enters the message !protest, they declare that they want to hold a protest. A message that a protest is started is sent to the government of unica and the citizen gets the right to place certain objects on the capital roads for the next 60 minutes.

Person.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the interaction.

Citizen.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the interaction.

LocationToDisplay.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="ChatSent">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="ChatSent">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position of the citizen when they performed the action.

properties.Title: Right to Protest
properties.UserDescription: Citizens have the right to peacefully protest. They may do so by gathering on a public property like the capital roads. This includes using vehicles, signs, chairs, benches or construction posts to sit on or block off property. A protest is only valid as long as at least one citizen is physically present. Courts may order a protest to dissolve if the interest of the public on dissolving it is higher than the interest of the protesting individuals to exercise their basic rights. The latter is considered high as long as the impact of the protest is avoidable. If the senate is in session and at least three members of the senate are physically present in the senate, protests may not take place in a radius of five claims around the senate building. Likewise, if a court is in session at the court house, no protest may take place in a radius of five claims around it.

Location.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PlaceOrPickUpObject">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PlaceOrPickUpObject">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position where the interaction took place.
